semantic_title: Exempt Conditions from POA Reporting Requirements
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Exempt from Reporting

content.full_text: Leave the 'present on admission' field blank if the condition is on the list of ICD-10-CM codes for which this field is not applicable. This is the only circumstance in which the field may be left blank. (Evidence: pg no: 118, L20-L23)
content.summary: Specific ICD-10-CM codes are exempt from POA reporting and should have the POA field left blank (Evidence: pg no: 118, L20-L23)
key_concepts: Exempt condition list (Evidence: pg no: 118, L20)
Blank POA field requirement (Evidence: pg no: 118, L21-L22)
Only circumstance for blank field (Evidence: pg no: 118, L22-L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Leave the present on admission field blank for exempt conditions (Evidence: pg no: 118, L21-L22)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a condition appears on the official exempt list, the POA field must be left blank rather than assigned any indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L21-L23)
common_applications: Codes specifically designated as not applicable for POA

workflow_steps: Step 1: Check if condition is on exempt list
Step 2: If exempt, leave POA field blank
Step 3: Do not assign any POA indicator
